segments.text: I notice the water just pouring out of the sink, and it’s making me really anxious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is just standing there, drying dishes like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle is getting bigger, and it’s going to ruin the floor if she doesn’t turn off the faucet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe she hasn’t noticed it yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just streaming down the cabinets, and she’s completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she might be the kind of person who ignores problems until they’re too big to handle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, and she’s just polishing a plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s ever going to look down and see the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just spreading everywhere, and she doesn’t even care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like shouting at her to turn off the faucet before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
